intro: Bystropogon dentatus, commonly known as the toothed spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-yellow in color. Bystropogon dentatus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
